channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Network offers integrated support for the vulnerable
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A network formed last November has been reaching out and befriending vulnerable individuals in the community, such as tissue sellers and cardboard and can collectors.

item.title: No kite, drone flying on some days ahead of NDP
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

With the National Day Parade (NDP) drawing near, flying of kites and drones over much of Singapore will be banned on selected days in June, July and August unless authorised.

item.title: Government-run columbariums reopen today
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Government-managed columbariums in Choa Chu Kang, Mandai and Yishun will be open to the public again from today after more than two months of closure due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Business groups raise over $500,000 to help migrant workers
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Over $500,000 has been raised by the business community to help migrant workers who have been hit hard by the pandemic, said the Association of Small and Medium Enterprises (ASME) yesterday.

item.title: 14 digital bank hopefuls move to next stage of assessment
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The process to establish digital banks here has moved forward, with 14 of the 21 initial applications having met the eligibility criteria, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: COE bidding exercises to resume on July 6
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Certificate of entitlement (COE) bidding exercises will resume, with the first exercise starting on July 6.

item.title: CDAC pledges $5m more to help needy affected by Covid-19
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

From raising income caps for tuition assistance schemes to doing away with annual means-testing, the Chinese Development Assistance Council (CDAC) is changing the way it helps more low-income families at a time when Covid-19 has hit hard, said its chairman and Education Minister Ong Ye Kung yesterday.

item.title: 14 public transport staff have caught Covid-19
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Fourteen public bus or train staff members have caught Covid-19, but none has been found to have infected commuters, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Emerging Stronger Taskforce says it will engage diverse views, in reply to letter
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The evolving Covid-19 situation and the need to keep abreast of rapid changes in the global economy meant that the Emerging Stronger Taskforce, formed to guide Singapore's economic recovery, had to be kept relatively small to move nimbly, co-chairman Desmond Lee said yesterday.

item.title: askST: Are informal car-pool services allowed in phase 2?
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Senior Minister of State for Transport Janil Puthucheary said in a Facebook post on Wednesday that paid car-pool services made through booking platforms can also resume. Information needed for contact tracing will be recorded at the point of booking.

item.title: Faster way to test for threat of miscarriage in pregnant women
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Local researchers have developed a test that can gauge a pregnancy outcome in 30 minutes or less in cases of a threat of miscarriage.

item.title: Ridership on public transport expected to rise further from today
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Public transport ridership during the morning peak hours has doubled since the end of the circuit breaker on June 2, with more people returning to schools and workplaces.

item.title: Bangladeshi cleared of compatriot's murder; guilty of causing grievous hurt
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A Bangladeshi national, who was tried for murdering a senior member of a rival contraband cigarette syndicate, was acquitted yesterday and convicted instead of causing grievous hurt with a weapon.

item.title: Workers must continue to remain in dorms on rest days for now
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Migrant workers must continue to remain in their dormitories on their rest days as the second phase of Singapore's reopening starts today.

item.title: Former DPM Jayakumar appointed NUS pro-chancellor
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Former deputy prime minister S. Jayakumar has been appointed a pro-chancellor of the National University of Singapore (NUS).

item.title: No mid-year bonus for civil servants; pay cuts for senior officers
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

None of Singapore's 85,000 civil servants will receive any mid-year bonus this year, amid the economic gloom caused by the Covid-19 pandemic. The last time this happened was in 2009 during the global financial crisis.

item.title: Public service stands with rest of nation to face tough times: Chan
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Minister-in-charge of the Public Service Chan Chun Sing thanked civil servants for their hard work and dedication yesterday, following the announcement that they will not receive a mid-year bonus this year.

item.title: New translation tool for Berita Harian readers
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Readers of the Malay-language newspaper Berita Harian (BH) will now be able to instantly translate the news into English, with help from a new translation tool.

item.title: It's midnight, and time to eat out
New cluster in Tuas dormitory; four new community cases
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A new coronavirus cluster - a dormitory at 10 Tech Park Crescent in Tuas - was announced yesterday.

item.title: Hainanese beef noodle seller's son defamed rival: Court
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Concerned that their original Orchard Emerald Hainanese beef noodle recipe may be tweaked and used by a former franchisee, the owner's son took to Facebook and Instagram to slam the food at the latter's shop.

item.title: Many still plan to stay home this weekend
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Instead of heading out tomorrow, Madam Sim Sai Hoon will have her granddaughter come over to her house for a cookie baking session.

item.title: More community plots sprouting up to cater to gardening enthusiasts
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of community plots for gardening enthusiasts will more than double by 2030, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: 'Tourist' jailed over graft and false GST refund claims
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

He was linked to a group of Indian nationals who defrauded the taxman out of $570,000 by making false Goods and Services Tax (GST) refund claims and bribing a Customs officer who approved them.

item.title: Malls, shops gear up to ensure safety measures and crowd control
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

​While many shoppers may be cautious about heading out today - the first day of phase two of the economy's re-opening - shopping malls and their operators are going all out to ensure everything is safe and ready.

item.title: NS defaulter given four months' jail
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean man who left for Australia when he was 11 has been sentenced to four months' jail for defaulting on his national service (NS) obligations.

item.title: 35 couples tie the knot at National Museum instead of ROM
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Tying the knot these days is a stressful affair, with plans disrupted by the coronavirus and masks to be worn at all times.

item.title: More to be tested for Covid-19 as phase two begins
item.description:
June 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will carry out more Covid-19 tests as the country enters phase two of its reopening today, allowing a long list of social and economic activities to resume.

item.title: askST: Dining out? Eat, think and be wary
item.description:
June 19, 2020 4:00 AM

This is the second of an eight-part series brought to you by the Ministry of Trade and Industry, Manpower Ministry and Enterprise Singapore.
